intro: Nunnezharia conocarpa, commonly known as the Peruvian wild coffee, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries containing a single seed. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
